page.title: 01 The Keith Local Area
page.content: The town of Keith is situated in the N.E. of Scotland,where the main road and railway routes from Aberdeen and Inverness cross the R.Isla.The R.Isla runs through Keith and divides the town into two parts,Keith and Fife-Keith.The older parts of the town are laid out on a grid pattern,with streets and lanes at right angles.The population of Keith is 4340 persons.Keith is the main service centre for the surrounding rural area and farming is one of the mainstays of the local economy.The chief industries of Keith are the manufacture of woollen goods and whisky.To the S.E.of Keith lies the Balloch Hill which is covered in trees planted by the Forestry Commission.Looking N.E.you can see Broomhill Cemetry and the village of Newmill.To the S.and W.there is a varied landscape of farms and woodland.
